Topic.Title: Obama: Higher Taxes, More Spending, No Debt Limit, No Compromises

Message.Msg: 1. Reduce the deficit to pre-2008 levels (no, bush is not without some of the blame). 2. Stop the stampede of investment capital out of the U.S. and incentivize global investors and companies to return to the U.S. and start investing in jobs-producing industry. If you can propose a plausible solution to those two, huge problems... then I'm behind you. The huge deficit and the 50-year low in capital spending are the biggest problems in America today. If you acknowledge that and propose a viable solution, then you're a rational man with a good idea. S

Topic.Title: Obama: Higher Taxes, More Spending, No Debt Limit, No Compromises

Message.Msg: ... it's been on the table ever since. One of the stickiest elements in that proposal has been capping deductions at $17,000 (far below what those in the top 2% typically deduct... their deductions are often 6-figures). Another is only allowing deductions at a 25% rate for those above the 35% tax bracket. The GOP offered Obama the $800 billion in taxes on the wealthy that he asked for in the election. Obama has countered with this set of "demands": 1. $1.4 trillion in new taxes on the wealthy 2. $400 billion in NEW domestic spending 3. Unlimited power to raise the debt ceiling 4. No proposals to reduce spending or reign in entitlements These are the facts as they stand today. The house GOP and Obama should be judged on them accordingly. Each of us can decide for ourselves who is bargaining in good faith and who is not. S
